text: William Doune was a 14th-century English priest.University of Leicester Doune was ordained in 1342. He was Archdeacon of Leicester from 1354 until his death in 1361.During this period there was a counter-claimant, Arnald de Gavarreto He was a noted Pluralist. In 1860 his will was discovered,"The Medieval Canon Law: Teaching, Literature and Transmission" Owen, D.M. p68: Cambridge; CUP; 1990 and it shows a man efficient in collecting his dues but whose conscience sometimes troubled him. == Notes == ==Also see== * Diocese of Lincoln * Diocese of Peterborough * Diocese of Leicester * Archdeacon of Leicester Category:Archdeacons of Leicester Category:14th-century English people Category:1361 deaths
title: William Doune
